Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: OVERGROWN TREE O/S no 71, 31st July
item.description:
Resident reporting the tree o/s No 71 is overgrown & needs pruning back, it is overcoming onto her driveway and there is a lot of bird mess the tree surgeons were down there today, the tree is overgrown and needs pruning they couldn't do it as it was not on the tree list and couldn't do it. There is also a couple of other trees down the street and she did receive a text to say it that it will be pruned. It is cutting light out from the top window, residents are worried as it sways in the wind and residents feel vulnerable, the amount of leaves makes it difficult as they have elderly residents who visit. One sweep every day the brown GW can be filled up. It is wide and huge it is an Ash tree it needs trimming back for a residential road. Please could someone look into this asap before Autumn especially if someone trips /slips as leaves get slushy in the rain..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water, 31st July
item.description:
The road has dips in it, this results in the road collecting water when it rains and then it gets splashed on to the people waiting for the bus at the bus stop. Kent House Bus Stop (BA)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Road, Penge, London

item.title: Ref7663947, 31st July
item.description:
More than 28 days have elapsed since the last council comment on the website: "We have notified the responsible party of their duties and responsibilities and informed them that further enforcement action may be taken if the issue is not resolved. For overhanging vegetation reports please allow 28 days for the responsible party to arrange action before notifying us of any continued obstruction. State changed to: Closed Posted by Bromley Council at 10:42, Friday 20 June 2025" What happens now?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa Dumped Again on Wheathill Road, 31st July
item.description:
Yet another large item — this time a broken sofa — has been dumped on the pavement at Wheathill Road. This is one of the many serious flytipping incidents here in as many days. The council’s inaction in putting up a more long-term solution is inviting repeat offences, and residents are fed up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly posting on Clapton terrace, 31st July
item.description:
